file_content.text: Thanks for the assist. Those civs would be under a pile of rubble now if not for you.
Tefani. Looks like your reinforcements are back.
There they are! The Supreme Chancellor's well-oiled machine. I see why you all keep together.
What a performance, Master Jedi! If we had ten more of you, the war would be over tomorrow.
It was a pleasure watching you work, Major. Makes me wish Havoc Squad needed an engineer.
One hired gun, a few dead mercs, and here we all are. We're lucky you're not on the Hutts' side.
One hundred percent of the building's occupants were rescued and accounted for. That's what I call a good day at the office.
You're a pleasure to work with, Tefani. The Protectors can call on me anytime.
Glad I could help.
No point in doing anything unless you're having fun, right?
The Hutts had those people brainwashed. It took some doing to get them to leave.
It almost wasn't.
No kidding? Glad you stuck with it. Fear makes people do crazy things.
Is there anyone else to evacuate on this mesa, or are the Protectors moving on?
What happens now?
We lost fifteen percent of the occupants when the building's interior collapsed, though. Roop Gawash and friends, I'm guessing?
Roop and his family wouldn't listen to reason. I couldn't waste any more time on them.
Nothing I could do.
You need to work on your people skills. Plenty of ways to lure a scared cat out of a trash compactor.
Roop took off inside the building, and his family followed. There was nothing I could do.
[Lie] They ran away.
Chased 'em, maybe. But then we might have lost you, too. Wouldn't want the heat for that.
Those idiots deserved to stay behind. Better hope for the next generation without them.
Too stupid to live.
Ouch. Sorry I asked.
Talaos City should be pretty well cleared in a few hours, thanks to you. I had Cash put a little something together to show our appreciation.
Better get back to it. Next evac means repairing a light bridge. A bridge made of light! What'll they come up with next?
The numbers aren't getting better. You've got to get those civs out before that building comes down.
Sir, I've asked Chief Hurkwill three times. They can't spare anyone. Will you please come back now?
Nah, it's practically cozy out here. So Hurkwill's men aren't an option. There's got to be someone else back there with you.
Or a lot of someones. That's the Supreme Chancellor's squad. Over here, you guys!
Use your eyes, Cash. There's a Jedi, right there. Master Jedi! Can we have a minute?
Come on, you're letting the commander of Havoc Squad get away. This way, Major!
Look, an independent contractor, just looking for a job. Hey, you! Credits over here!
Cash Zarrin, Logistics Specialist Tefani. We're with the Protectors--Republic MedCorps, Second Battalion. Official evacuation forces for frightened civilians everywhere.
Nice to see a friendly face in this chaos. How can I help you, Tefani?
Glad to meet you.
And everyone says Jedi are cold! For starters, we could use that lightsaber of yours.
The people of the Republic need a group dedicated to their safety.
A fine mission.
You sound like my captain. But he's right--being a hero ain't a bad way to make a living.
I've been with the military a long time, but I've never heard of you.
Must be a new unit.
Captain doesn't like a lot of press. Me, I wouldn't mind a few medals.
Between the mercs and the groundquakes, Makeb's kept you busy.
Good place for it.
We're free as birds right now. How'd you like to put us back to work?
I assume you didn't come up with that title yourselves?
You're named "the Protectors"?
Nah, some orphaned kids from Corellia started it. Just kind of stuck after that.
You look like you need an evacuation, yourselves. Why aren't you armed?
Not much of a force.
We're non-combat, staffed by civilians and ex-military volunteers. Worked out fine--until now.
Big seismic event coming up. We're talking big enough to devour Talaos City. Got to get these people out now if we're going to beat the clock.
Problem is, Talaos City's on lockdown. The Hutts have turned all the keys and put the Regulators on street patrol. I think one of 'em's eyeing me now....
Keep your head down and don't engage. I'll be there as quick as I can.
Stay put, I'm coming.
No, no, I'm fine. Me and a couple scouts got ourselves a nice piece of cover.
So you need someone to take on the Regulators while the Protectors escape?
You need a rescue?
What are you talking to me for? Run back to camp before he sees you!
Then get out of there, fool.
Thank you.
The Regulators aren't a problem for me, they're a problem for our evac. They're sitting guard on some buildings at the corner of Groundquake and Epicenter.
If the quake hits while the buildings are still full... well, it'll definitely lower the property values. We need the mercs out of our way so we can evacuate.
Just point me towards the buildings, and those mercs will be history.
I can handle that.
You've got a very strange way of saying things, Tefani.
Property values?
I'll take "strange." Not the worst thing I've been called.
You're out there already. Pick up a blaster and start shooting.
Do it yourselves.
I'm an engineer. I could try calculating them to death, but they'd need to stand still first.
I'll transmit you coordinates, soon as this seismic scan is done... uh-oh. Better hang on to something.
That was a warning, and we're not getting another. Cash, get the speeders ready. Our reinforcements will clear the mercs and get inside the buildings.
Once you're in, hit the emergency alarm. The civs will run out, the speeders will pick them up, and we all meet back here to shake hands. Sound good?
I'm usually on the front lines. It's rare I get to rescue civilians.
I'm excited, actually.
Captain's always looking for new recruits.
I can see why the Protectors made you their logistics specialist.
An excellent plan.
Aww, don't make me blush, Master Jedi.
Take down the mercs, move out the civs. Easy enough.
Affirmative.
I like your attitude, Major.
We should hit the cantina, play a few hands of pazaak.
Why stop there?
I'll have to take a groundquake check on that one, Captain.
Shaking hands is a little impersonal for me.
[Flirt] Could be better.
Too bad I'm married. Cash here might kiss you, though.
I've got plenty to do on this planet before it falls apart.
Let's make it fast.
Don't we all.
Here are the coordinates. Speeders are fueled up and ready to go. We'll be in position when you are.
No good. [Refuse quest]
We're in the middle of an evac here. Talk to Chief Hurkwill if you need information.
Another building emptied. Can we keep you?
All clear here. Head on down to the next one!
First building's evacuated. Keep those mercs busy!
Almost done. We've got to be setting some kind of record.
